intro: Conyza androrangensis, commonly known as the Androrangensis fleabane, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that attract various pollinators. Conyza androrangensis is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
